>amazing, yet another person that has found glad.ï¿½
>where did you find the
>demo?

Well I had the demo years ago on my old pc. I probably
found it from a link on Cnet or another download site.

Well it's too bad G:BF isn't likely to come out any
time soon (if at all).

What's this OpenGlad thing? Is it the same as the
original unregistered version? Would I buy the two
seperately?

And Thanks for the informative responses.



--- Tom Ricket <TRicket@...> wrote:
> 1)       Yes, you can still buy it, although the
> site we were hosted on
> started having problems recently.  You're correct,
> though, in that it hasn't
> been updated for a number of years now, although
> some nifty people at
> SnowStorm made a new Win32 port of the game.  The
> original is still being
> sold through Albert's Ambry
>
(http://www.alberts.com:8080/Ambry/Search?Type=KeyWord
>
<http://www.alberts.com:8080/Ambry/Search?Type=KeyWord&StartAfter=&maxHits=1
> 0&AndOr=all&OS=&SearchText=gladiator>
>
&StartAfter=&maxHits=10&AndOr=all&OS=&SearchText=gladiator).
> 
> 2)       G:BF pretty much got abandoned when the
> four main programmers had
> to get real jobs and stop working on Gladiator all
> the time :-(  ... it's
> kind of a pipe dream to get back together and work
> on it, but so far
> Blizzard has kept us too busy.
> 
>  
> 
> --Tom
